meanings.definition: To block or close up (an opening or passage)
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree obturates the path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers obturate the hole in the wall with bricks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel obturates the entrance to its burrow with acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter obturates the silence of the room like a burst of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: The snowfall obturates the roads, creating a winter wonderland.

meanings.definition: To obstruct or fill up (a space or cavity)
meanings.sent1: The overflowing trash bin obturates the alleyway.
meanings.sent2: The excess foam obturates the bathtub, making it difficult to drain.
meanings.sent3: The curious child obturates the toy box with all his favorite playthings.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety obturates his mind, clouding his thoughts like a dense fog.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons obturate the ceiling, adding a festive touch to the party.
